contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2012}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Nyū'''|丹生郡|Nyū-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] in [[Fukui Prefecture]], Japan. As of 2005, the district has an estimated population of 23,995 and a population density of 157 persons per km². The total area is 152.83 km². ==Towns and villages== *[[Echizen, Fukui (town)|Echizen]] ==Mergers== *On 1 February 2005 the towns of [[Asahi, Fukui|Asahi]] and [[Ota, Fukui|Ota]], and the village of [[Miyazaki, Fukui|Miyazaki]] merged into the town of [[Echizen, Fukui (town)|Echizen]]. *On 1 February 2006 the towns of [[Miyama, Fukui|Miyama]] (from [[Asuwa District, Fukui|Asuwa District]]) and [[Shimizu, Fukui|Shimizu]], and the village of [[Koshino, Fukui|Koshino]] merged into the city of [[Fukui, Fukui|Fukui]]. {{Fukui}} {{coord|35|58|12|N|136|04|05|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nyu District, Fukui}} [[Category:Districts in Fukui Prefecture]] {{Fukui-geo-stub}}
